image.altText: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs walks away.

props.synopsis: Less than nine months ago, David Speirs held one of South Australia's most prominent and important jobs: the state's alternative premier and leader of the Liberal Party. Now, those titles have been replaced by "convicted drug supplier".

title.children: David Speirs has gone from alternative SA premier to convicted drug supplier

image.altText: Fremantle forward Josh Treacy pumps his fist in celebration

props.synopsis: Adelaide star Izak Rankine pulls out the party tricks in the first quarter against Fremantle, but the Dockers lead thanks to a fast start in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Dockers dominate early as Rankine drills incredible 'no-step' goal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Thilthorpe heads into the rooms with a hand injury

image.altText: A farmer looks to the sky with machinery in the background.

props.synopsis: Anzac Day marks the traditional start for planting winter crops, but this year farmers are hoping for rain as they begin planting their crops in the dry.

title.children: Aussie farmers' grain gamble as rain fails to arrive before Anzac Day

image.altText: A woman sits with a typewriter on a brown wooden table.

props.synopsis: Pam Ashman has sat courtside for thousands of netball games, keeping score by hand and recording fixtures on her typewriter. Despite the painstaking work, the 78-year-old volunteer vows to "never ever" use a computer.

title.children: Trusty typewriter and a dedicated volunteer keeps netball league on track

image.altText: A son and father stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: As 94-year-old Australian war veteran Patrick Forbes prepares for his final Anzac Day march, he reflects back on his family's history of service which saw three members awarded the distinguished Military Cross.

title.children: Final Anzac Day march for veteran from three-time Military Cross family

image.altText: A sign saying Women's and Children's Hospital and public car park

props.synopsis: The personal data of more than 2,000 inpatients involved sleep studies at the Women's and Children's Hospital in Adelaide since 2018 has been accessed in a ransomware attack, with those affected being warned of identity theft risks.

title.children: Data of more than 2,000 SA patients hacked in ransomware attack

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: WARNING: This story contains details that readers may find distressing. The family of a baby who died 42 hours after being "violently shaken" by his father has been left with "silence, grief and an emptiness that will never fully go away", a court has heard.

title.children: Family tells court of ongoing pain over death of 'innocent, defenceless' baby

image.altText: Hands holding a piece of ore, which has a metallic shine to it.

props.synopsis: A partnership between a Broken Hill family and a mining company is attempting to re-inject life into an old mine where drilling samples have revealed promising signs for the future.

title.children: High-grade silver, lead and zinc found at 140yo mine in outback NSW

image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: A concept image of two workers in high-vis walking past a row of large batteries.

props.synopsis: A large battery project in South Australia sells for nearly $500 million as investment in renewable energy surges.

title.children: Millions invested in big batteries amid net zero transition

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: The two popes sit across from one another in a library with a large white box on the table between them

props.synopsis: Just 10 days after Pope Francis was appointed head of the Catholic Church, he received an ominous gift from his predecessor — a large white box.

title.children: Pope Francis was once given a box full of 'abuse, corruption, dark dealings'

image.altText: Dutton election campaign Tasmania

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton said some of the 41,000 cuts would be achieved by not proceeding with unfilled vacancies, but political opponents and experts say the numbers don't add up.

title.children: Public service cuts only for Canberra, Dutton says, which Labor calls 'impossible'

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: The landscape of White Cliffs from the air

props.synopsis: Before the remote town of White Cliffs got state-funded transport to Broken Hill 300 kilometres away, some locals went long stretches without essential services and supplies.

title.children: Outback bus service 'essential' to far-flung opal mining town

image.altText: Pauline Hanson with daughter Lee Hanson with some hot chips.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson, the leader of One Nation, has worked in politics for nearly three decades. Now, her daughter Lee is hoping to join her — running as a Senate candidate in southern Tasmania.

title.children: After years of urging, Pauline Hanson's daughter is running for One Nation

image.altText: Pilbara Minerals spodumene rock

props.synopsis: China now dominates the entire rare earths ecosystem, refining around 90 per cent of all coveted elements. It leaves Trump's America particularly vulnerable, as the Albanese government proposes a national stockpile.

title.children: How Trump dealt himself a dud hand on rare earths

image.altText: Sign saying Dangerous Coast

props.synopsis: A search and rescue operation is underway at Salmon Holes, near Albany, after reports of a man falling off a cliff and into the water on Friday afternoon.

title.children: Rescue helicopter called to Albany after man falls off cliff

image.altText: Two seashells.

props.synopsis: A school student has discovered a "very, very rare" seashell during a school holiday session at the Tasmanian Museum and Art Gallery.

title.children: 8yo girl makes 'astounding' discovery of tiny, rare seashell at museum

image.altText: A photograph of a young woman with a flower in her hair hangs from a tree branch.

props.synopsis: Family friends of Audrey Griffin, who is believed to have been murdered on the NSW Central Coast last month, say they have mixed emotions following the death of the man accused of her killing.

title.children: Death of Audrey Griffin's accused killer denies family closure, friends say

image.altText: US defense secretary pete hegseth smirks at the camera

props.synopsis: The unsecured internet connection is the latest revelation about Mr Hegseth's use of the app and raises the possibility that sensitive defence information could have been hacked.

title.children: Hegseth had 'dirty' internet line in his office to use Signal, sources say

image.altText: Wreaths on a beach with a shipwreck in the background.

props.synopsis: More than a century after hospital ship TSS Maheno was wrecked on the shores of K'gari (Fraser Island), families of its crew have gathered for a special Anzac Day ceremony.

title.children: This Queensland island shipwreck once rescued Anzacs from Gallipoli

image.altText: Rescuers look for survivors amid the rubble of a building

props.synopsis: The US president demands Moscow ceases bombarding the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv as Washington attempts to broker a peace deal.

title.children: Trump 'not happy' with Putin's missile attack on Kyiv

image.altText: Line of people voting at Perth polling station.

props.synopsis: More than a million people have already cast their ballots for the federal election early. Some experts say the polling day has just become the last day to vote.

title.children: Early voting becomes new normal in Australia

image.altText: Composite Duttts Albo

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese have yet to set foot in an Indigenous community during their election campaigns. However, both have made multiple visits to Melbourne.

title.children: The places political leaders have been avoiding this election

image.altText: A man holds a sign at a protest that reads, "Water crimes, war crimes" among a sea of green and white flags

props.synopsis: Relations between India and Pakistan deteriorate after an attack left 26 people dead, with New Delhi blaming Islamabad for the violence.

title.children: Will Pakistan go to war with India over water?

image.altText: Monash IVF sign

props.synopsis: The fertility company has responded to questions from the Australian Securities Exchange after its recent embryo mix-up dropped the share price.

title.children: Monash IVF responds to ASX after share price tumbled in baby mix-up

image.altText: Peter Dutton with Andrew Hastie, campaigning in Perth

props.synopsis: Whatever the result on May 3, even people within the Liberals think they have run a very poor national campaign. Not just poor, but odd.

title.children: Coalition's campaign lacks good planning and enough elbow grease

image.altText: two friends Nepal

props.synopsis: They didn't know each other before the earthquake. Now, after losing a leg each, they have found something strong, friendship.

title.children: Earthquake survivors turn tragedy into lifelong friendship

image.altText: Four brand new cars on a production line are inspected by factory workers.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's promise to end electric vehicle subsidies could drive up prices for popular EVs by more than $15,000 under a typical novated lease and have an almost immediate effect on sales.

title.children: Coalition vow to end EV lease discount may inflate prices $15K

image.altText: A middle-aged, fair-haired woman in a brightly-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis: Katy Gallagher says her seniority as finance minister helps her advocate for Canberra. She admits independent Senator David Pocock is popular, but says her party has more muscle.

title.children: Gallagher seeks fourth Senate win but concedes Pocock's popularity

image.altText: Smoke fills the sky from a wildfire amidst pine trees in new jersey

props.synopsis: Police allege Joseph Kling left the wooden pallets without fully extinguishing the blaze which sparked the wildfire.

title.children: Teenager charged with arson after US fire forces evacuation of 5,000 people

image.altText: Two shelves full of sake bottles, back-lit on a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Over the last decade, Australia has emerged as one of the most promising international markets for Japanese sake.

title.children: Australia's thirst for sake surges as imports and local brewing boom

image.altText: Composite of pop star Katy Perry wear oragne outfit with white background, left, with Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry, right

props.synopsis: It's a battle between Katy Perry and Katie Perry. One is an international pop super star, the other an Australian fashion designer. Now, after 15 years the case has reached its climax, landing in the High Court. So, who will get to claim the name?

title.children: ABC News Daily: Katie Perry vs Katy Perry in the High Court
